author: cmpilato
msg: revisions to be robust in the face of renames in the source URL's
history.  While here, enhance this (and the now-named _eligible) API
to accept a peg revision for the source URL, which further empowers
callers to get the information that really want (and avoids the
obvious problems of prior code which fell over if the source URL no
Rework this to limit output to merged revision which actually
fall in the history of the queried source.
Now accepts 'src_peg_revision' parameter, used instead of a hard-coded
HEAD.  Also, tweak a bunch of comments.
(svn_cl__mergeinfo): Parse an optional source URL peg revision from
the command-line.  Track rename of svn_client_mergeinfo_log_eligible().

author: glasser
msg: Support memcache for the revision DAG node cache.
To serialize immutable nodes, we essentially just save the noderev;
for mutable nodes, we specifically save the fields that are in the DAG
node itself (because caching mutable noderevs is not safe).
(svn_fs_fs__initialize_caches): Use memcache for the revision DAG
(read_header_block): Take a stream instead of a file.
(get_node_revision_body): Factor out reading and parsing noderev

author: kameshj
msg: When we backported r30162 (which is in between r30145 and r30185 and
both r30145 and r30185 were not merged) from /trunk,
we missed merging one change to merge_tests-19 i.e around line 2003
of subversion/tests/cmdline/merge_tests.py(post merge of r30145 and r30185).
This missing change causes merge_tests-19 to fail.
(merge_skips_obstructions): Cherry pick unmerged change from r30162.
Remove r30145 and r30185 from the Approved changes section.

author: kameshj
msg: Merge r30145 and r30185 from trunk to 1.5.x.
